system.description: The least martial of the warriors, their outlook on life is that of the combat medic, focusing on keeping others alive on the front lines. Paladins are often leaders, as their charismatic charm draws followers to them and everyone likes to have a healer on their side. Paladins see themselves as somewhat better than most others as they have magical powers that other warriors lack. Paladins usually have a strong guiding force in their life to help those in need and do what is right. If you are a Paladin be righteous, concerned for others, and take charge.

overview.base: You can @L[Category:Block abilities]{block} non-@L[Keyword:Warded]{warded} @L[Keyword:UB]{UB} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks} with your @L[Category:Shields]{shields}. Any effects that would turn off or cut through @L[Keyword:Resistance]{resistances} affect this as well.

results.hit: Target is no longer @L[Condition:Charmed]{charmed} and any other @L[Category:Mental effects]{mental effects} on them @L[Core:Fizzles]{fizzles}.

overview.base:
If the target of this ritual is @L[Category:Undead creatures]{undead}, it is @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of @L[Category:Regeneration effects]{regeneration effects} and @L[Category:Reanimation effects]{reanimation effects} while this ritual is being cast. In addition, any @L[Category:Regeneration effects]{regeneration effects} or @L[Category:Reanimation effects]{reanimation effects} that target them during Fizzles during this time.

When this ritual is completed, make a @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} @L[Core:Tradecrafts]{check} to see if the @L[Category:Undead creatures]{undead} target is destroyed. The check's DC is typically equal to the battle rating of the target's undead type. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} may adjust the DC based on other factors as they see fit.

Exorcism can also be used to cleanse effects other than being @L[Category:Undead creatures]{undead}. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} decides the DC of the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} @L[Core:Tradecrafts]{check} based on the severity of the effect being cleansed. If the check is successful, the effect is removed and the target is destroyed in a similar manner to an @L[Category:Undead creatures]{undead} target. The target pulls stones from the Death Bag based on the severity of the effect being cleansed (see @L[Core:GM]{GM}).
overview.proficient: You may add @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} @L[Core:Tradecrafts]{check} regardless of whether or not you are proficient in @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest}.
overview.fluent: You may add @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} @L[Core:Tradecrafts]{check} regardless of whether or not you are fluent in @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest}.

results.save:
The target is "destroyed". They @L[Condition:Dead]{die}, they are @L[Condition:Ruined]{ruined}, and they pull additional stones from the Death Bag depending on the extent of the undead blight being cleansed from them.
  • @L[Ability:Partial Undead]{Partial undead}: +1 stones
  • @L[Ability:Minor Undead]{Minor undead}: +2 stones
  • @L[Ability:Full Undead]{Full undead}: +5 stones
  • @L[Ability:Greater Undead]{Greater undead}: +10 stones

The target also pulls an additional stone for each century they've spent as an undead creature. Assuming they survive, their body must be @L[Ability:Summon the Dead]{Reconstructed} and then they can be @L[Category:Revival effects]{revived} in a non-undead state.
results.fail: You pay an amount of @L[Core:MP]{MP} and @L[Core:HP]{HP} equal to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} @L[Core:Tradecrafts]{check's} DC.

value.variable: An amount of @L[Core:MP]{MP} equal to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} @L[Core:Tradecrafts]{check's} DC. Paid only on failure.
An amount of @L[Core:HP]{HP} equal to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} @L[Core:Tradecrafts]{check's} DC. Paid only on failure.

overview.base:
When this ritual is completed, make a @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} check to see if the targeted item is disenchanted. The check's DC is entirely up to @L[Core:GM]{GM} discretion, but the following can be used as a benchmark.
  • Non-passively magic items: 4
  • Common passively magic items: 8
  • Uncommon passively magic items: 12
  • Rare passively magic items: 16
  • Mythic passively magic items: 20
  • Legendary passively magic items: 50+
These benchmarks are for reference only and the @L[Core:GM]{GM} may adjust them as they see fit. Item rarity may or may not correspond to how challenging it is to disenchant.
overview.proficient: You may add @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} check regardless of whether or not you are proficient in @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest}.
overview.fluent: You may add @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} check regardless of whether or not you are fluent in @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest}.

results.save: The item is @L[Property:Destroyed]{destroyed} and any @L[Category:Magical properties]{magical properties} of it are removed. An number of @L[Core:MP]{MP} equal to 20 times the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} check's DC is released (although you do not gain it).
results.fail: You pay an amount of @L[Core:MP]{MP} and @L[Core:HP]{HP} equal to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} check's DC.

value.variable: An amount of @L[Core:MP]{MP} equal to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} check's DC. Paid only on failure.
An amount of @L[Core:HP]{HP} equal to the @L[Tradecraft:Priest]{priest} check's DC. Paid only on failure.

overview.base:
You gain a @L[Category:Ritual delivery spells]{ritual spell} corresponding to the domain of your deity. It is @L[Category:Divinely powered abilities]{divinely powered} instead of @L[Category:Magically powered abilities]{magically powered}. You may spend 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP} when casting it to do so as a @L[Category:Single action abilities]{single action}.
Abilities by Domain
Domain Ability
Celestial @L[Ability:Zone of Light or Darkness]{Zone of Light or Darkness}
Crafting @L[Ability:Reconstruction Field]{Reconstruction Field}
Death @L[Ability:Spawn Point]{Spawn Point}
Destruction @L[Ability:Circle of Fire]{Circle of Fire}
Fortune @L[Ability:Virtuous Circle]{Virtuous Circle}
Healing @L[Ability:Circle of Healing]{Circle of Healing}
Hearth @L[Ability:Circle of Protection]{Circle of Protection}
Knowledge @L[Ability:Circle of Truth]{Circle of Truth}
Nature @L[Ability:Tangle Zone]{Tangle Zone}
Spirit @L[Ability:Ethereal Doorway]{Ethereal Doorway}
Trickster @L[Ability:Land of Illusions]{Land of Illusions}
Value @L[Ability:Tax Haven]{Tax Haven}
Weather @L[Ability:Storm Shelter]{Storm Shelter}
